newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -Bunds in poor shape,more losses to 100.83.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -Bunds in poor shape,more losses to 100.83.

text.p: The technical outlook for June Bund futures has deteriorated sharply and the market is looking to slide to 100.83 ahead of a possible break below trendline support at 100.00, technical analysts said on Thursday.
They said any spike up towards 101.30 resistance should be used as a selling opportunity ahead of further potential losses.
"The outlook for Bunds is pretty bad," said Guenter Redeker, technical analyst at Chase here.
"We broke the uptend on weekly charts at 101.06 yesterday, so the next objective for the market is 100.83."
By 0656 GMT, the June Bund on LIFFE was down 0.19 at 101.04.
Below 100.83, Redeker put the next target at 100.28, followed by trendline support at 100.00.
"The market will determine medium term direction around those levels," he said. "So if it breaks 100.00 then it would mean a retest of 99.05, which is a low tested a few months ago."
Charts show the market hit a daily low of 99.05 on April 3.
Redeker said any upside potential would be limited to trendline resistance at 101.30. "An uptick into that area should be regarded as a shortening opportunity," he said.
He said only a break of 101.38 would give the market the potential to move higher up to trendline resistance at 101.65.
"But even that possible level should be used as a selling opportunity," said Redeker.
Francoise Skelley, head of global trading technical analysis at Credit Suisse First Boston in London, said in the very near term the market would bounce before a further move down.
"Very short term, the sell-off has left the market oversold on an hourly basis, so ahead of more declines it will bounce back to 101.25,38 -- and that will cap the market," she said.
Skelley said she was then looking for a test of 100.81 ahead of stronger support at 100.54,48.
By 0726 GMT, September Euromarks were down 0.01 at 96.72.
